verses.verse: To the chief Musician,<WH5329> A Psalm<WH4210> of David.<WH1732> O LORD,<WH3068> thou hast searched<WH2713> me, and known<WH3045> me.
Thou <WH859> knowest<WH3045> my downsitting<WH3427> and mine uprising,<WH6965> thou understandest<WH995> my thought<WH7454> afar off.<WH4480> <WH7350>
Thou compassest<WH2219> my path<WH734> and my lying down,<WH7252> and art acquainted<WH5532> with all<WH3605> my ways.<WH1870>
For <WH3588> there is not<WH369> a word<WH4405> in my tongue,<WH3956> but, lo,<WH2005> O LORD,<WH3068> thou knowest<WH3045> it altogether.<WH3605>
Thou hast beset<WH6696> me behind<WH268> and before,<WH6924> and laid<WH7896> thine hand<WH3709> upon<WH5921> me.
Such knowledge<WH1847> is too wonderful<WH6383> for<WH4480> me; it is high,<WH7682> I cannot<WH3808> <WH3201> attain unto it.
Whither <WH575> shall I go<WH1980> from thy spirit?<WH4480> <WH7307> or whither<WH575> shall I flee<WH1272> from thy presence?<WH4480> <WH6440>
If <WH518> I ascend up<WH5266> into heaven,<WH8064> thou<WH859> art there:<WH8033> if I make my bed<WH3331> in hell,<WH7585> behold,<WH2009> thou art there.
If I take<WH5375> the wings<WH3671> of the morning,<WH7837> and dwell<WH7931> in the uttermost parts<WH319> of the sea;<WH3220>
Even <WH1571> there<WH8033> shall thy hand<WH3027> lead<WH5148> me, and thy right hand<WH3225> shall hold<WH270> me.
If I say,<WH559> Surely<WH389> the darkness<WH2822> shall cover<WH7779> me; even the night<WH3915> shall be light<WH216> about<WH1157> me.

Yea, <WH1571> the darkness<WH2822> hideth<WH2821> not<WH3808> from<WH4480> thee; but the night<WH3915> shineth<WH215> as the day:<WH3117> the darkness<WH2825> and the light<WH219> are both alike to thee.
For <WH3588> thou<WH859> hast possessed<WH7069> my reins:<WH3629> thou hast covered<WH5526> me in my mother's<WH517> womb.<WH990>

I will praise<WH3034> thee; for<WH5921> <WH3588> I am fearfully<WH3372> and wonderfully<WH6395> made: marvelous<WH6381> are thy works;<WH4639> and that my soul<WH5315> knoweth<WH3045> right well.<WH3966>
My substance<WH6108> was not<WH3808> hid<WH3582> from<WH4480> thee, when<WH834> I was made<WH6213> in secret,<WH5643> and curiously wrought<WH7551> in the lowest parts<WH8482> of the earth.<WH776>

Thine eyes<WH5869> did see<WH7200> my substance, yet being unperfect;<WH1564> and in<WH5921> thy book<WH5612> all<WH3605> my members were written,<WH3789> which in continuance<WH3117> were fashioned,<WH3335> when as yet there was none<WH3808> <WH259> of them.
How <WH4100> precious<WH3365> also are thy thoughts<WH7454> unto me, O God!<WH410> how<WH4100> great<WH6105> is the sum<WH7218> of them!
If I should count<WH5608> them, they are more in number<WH7235> than the sand:<WH4480> <WH2344> when I awake,<WH6974> I am still<WH5750> with thee.<WH5973>
Surely <WH518> thou wilt slay<WH6991> the wicked,<WH7563> O God:<WH433> depart<WH5493> from<WH4480> me therefore, ye bloody<WH1818> men.<WH376>
For <WH834> they speak<WH559> against thee wickedly,<WH4209> and thine enemies<WH6145> take<WH5375> thy name in vain.<WH7723>
Do not<WH3808> I hate<WH8130> them, O LORD,<WH3068> that hate<WH8130> thee? and am not I grieved<WH6962> with those that rise up against<WH8618> thee?
I hate<WH8130> them with perfect<WH8503> hatred:<WH8135> I count<WH1961> them mine enemies.<WH341>
Search <WH2713> me, O God,<WH410> and know<WH3045> my heart:<WH3824> try<WH974> me, and know<WH3045> my thoughts: <WH8312>
And see<WH7200> if<WH518> there be any wicked<WH6090> way<WH1870> in me, and lead<WH5148> me in the way<WH1870> everlasting.<WH5769>
